Gatehouse.text: ... you blink as the familiar disorientation of extradimensional travel wears off and your eyes adjust to the darkness. You appear to be in a gloomy stone corridor, and a dead end at that. The air is stale and heavy, and the oppresive silence is broken only by your breathing.

You look around. Some crudely etched runes on nearby walls emit a desultory glow, but otherwise this section of  corridor is unremarkable.
This gate seems to have been a one way trip: you can see no immediate way back to the First Realm from here...
Above you a fixture on the ceiling gives off some kind of soft magical light.

Peering through the bars, the room beyond is gloomy and quiet. A dank, feral smell faintly tickles your nose.

On the far side of the room you can just make out what looks like some kind of lever.
Above you a fixture on the ceiling gives off some kind of soft magical light.
With a flurry of wings, you are suddenly assaulted from above!

The large lever mechanism looks tarnished and old but otherwise functional.

You wonder what hidden machinery it connects to...
You give the lever a hard yank.
A loud clanking and grinding fills the dungeon.
Large silky webs cover the walls and recede around the corner.

This area of the dungeon is even dustier, gloomier and more run down than what you have seen so far.

From the darkness you seem to feel many eyes watching you through the strands of webbing.
Swarming from the surrounding webbing, you are attacked by a group of disturbingly large spiders!

You brush cobwebs aside and peer nervously through the darkness. This area smells of mold, dust and fungus.

A spider, larger than the others, rouses itself angrily from a nest of bones in the far corner and moves to attack!
A pile of dry and dusty bones has been heaped in this dark corner.
Poking through the pile of moldy bones, you discover several items of interest...
With a loud *SPLAT* you hear something large and slimy drop to the ground behind you!
The portcullis is lowered and will not budge. You note a small lock mechanism with a keyhole near the ground...
Rounding the corner you nearly collide with a short, scruffy goblin who is furtively using a knife between the cracks of the northern wall.
In a flash the stranger confronts you!
Emmons- "Oh aye! What have we here?"
Emmons- "Could it be ... ye're newcomers to this here Second Realm?"
Emmons- "Ha! Newly arrived through the Great Gate eh! Been a while, quite a while, since Emmons has seen the likes of ye!"

Emmons- "Where are me manners?

Greetings travellers, from Emmons, called by some The Hand. On account of me skill at juggling."

Emmons- "Now mind you I have have little time for prattle. Got business to take care of.

No doubt ye'll be wanting to move on quickly to Ichiba..."

Emmons- "So listen mateys.

Emmons know these halls. There are three Gates outta here."

Emmons- "All will take ye to places in the crater.

If I were ye I'd take the center and make for the city. It's where all the action is."
Emmons- "Emmons has his own ways out. Farewell, mayhap ye'll find me in Ichiba some day!"
With a casual but surprisingly fast saunter, the goblin steps around the corner and out of sight.

Shallow puddles dot this area of gloomy passageways, and the air is cold and humid.

You wonder where the leak is.
Coming from behind this door is a faint hum. You pause to listen for a few moments, but no explanation is readily apparent.
